# Issue 25543: Implement Hopf algebras on ordered multiset partitions

archive/issues_025306.json:
```json
{
    "body": "The free (noncommutative) algebra generated by finite nonempty sets is given a Hopf algebra structure, with coproduct on finite sets `K` given by `\\Delta(K) = \\sum_{I \\sqcup J = K} I \\otimes J`.\n\nThis Hopf algebra gives formulas for primitives and antipode in other (combinatorial) Hopf algebras via \"transfer of structure\" as described in [LM2018]. This transfer was already implemented (in the special case of NCSYM) via :meth:`\n\nIt would be nice to implement this transfer for other cases. Getting this Hopf algebra and its dual within [SageMath](../wikis/SageMath) would be a good first step.\n\nREFERENCE:\n\n[LM2018] Lauve, Mastnak. *Bialgebra coverings and transfer of structure*. :arxiv:`1803.02691`.\n\nDepends on #25148\n\n**CC:**  @tscrim @darijgr @zabrocki @alauve @saliola amypang\n\n**Keywords:** IMA coding sprint, CHAs, ordered multiset partitions\n\n**Branch:** [public/combinat/implement_hopf_algebra_on_OMPs-25543](https://github.com/sagemath/sagetrac-mirror/tree/public/combinat/implement_hopf_algebra_on_OMPs-25543)\n\n**Commit:** [5b8cab91f7849bfa3e829a2d2143991f8c39b3b6](https://github.com/sagemath/sagetrac-mirror/commit/5b8cab91f7849bfa3e829a2d2143991f8c39b3b6)\n\n**Author:** Aaron Lauve\n\nIssue created by migration from https://trac.sagemath.org/ticket/25543\n\n",

    "labels": [
        "component: combinatorics",
        "minor",
        "enhancement"

    "milestone": "https://github.com/sagemath/sage/milestones/sage-8.4",
    "title": "Implement Hopf algebras on ordered multiset partitions",
    "type": "issue",
    "url": "https://github.com/sagemath/sage/issues/25543",
    "user": "https://github.com/alauve"

```
The free (noncommutative) algebra generated by finite nonempty sets is given a Hopf algebra structure, with coproduct on finite sets `K` given by `\Delta(K) = \sum_{I \sqcup J = K} I \otimes J`.

This Hopf algebra gives formulas for primitives and antipode in other (combinatorial) Hopf algebras via "transfer of structure" as described in [LM2018]. This transfer was already implemented (in the special case of NCSYM) via :meth:`

It would be nice to implement this transfer for other cases. Getting this Hopf algebra and its dual within [SageMath](../wikis/SageMath) would be a good first step.

REFERENCE:

[LM2018] Lauve, Mastnak. *Bialgebra coverings and transfer of structure*. :arxiv:`1803.02691`.

Depends on #25148

**CC:**  @tscrim @darijgr @zabrocki @alauve @saliola amypang

**Keywords:** IMA coding sprint, CHAs, ordered multiset partitions

**Branch:** [public/combinat/implement_hopf_algebra_on_OMPs-25543](https://github.com/sagemath/sagetrac-mirror/tree/public/combinat/implement_hopf_algebra_on_OMPs-25543)

**Commit:** [5b8cab91f7849bfa3e829a2d2143991f8c39b3b6](https://github.com/sagemath/sagetrac-mirror/commit/5b8cab91f7849bfa3e829a2d2143991f8c39b3b6)

**Author:** Aaron Lauve

Issue created by migration from https://trac.sagemath.org/ticket/25543

archive/issue_comments_394581.json:
```json
{
    "body": "<a id='comment:17'></a>\nSome more superficial comments:\n\n- I would rename `OMPBasis_OMPNSym` to `OMPNSymBasis_abstract` (at least, that is my understanding of its role).\n- Remove the period here: `around which the primitive is built.`\n- This is overindented:\n\n  ```\n        .. TODO::\n\n            - sort out the degree issues above. (search for \"wrong!!!\")\n  ```\n- For this:\n\n  ```\n  .. TODO: Do we need these tests, or are they checked within TestSuite?::\n  ```\n  the answer is yes, they are checked by the `_test_antipode` unless I am misremembering something.\n- `.. MATH::` needs a blankline before it (see `coproduct_on_basis`).\n- I would put the `TestSuite` tests in the `__init__` method rather than the class-level doc.\n- `*Warning:*` -> `.. WARNING::`.\n- The `__classcall_private__` will need doctests.",
    "created_at": "2018-10-13T00:11:53Z",
    "issue": "https://github.com/sagemath/sage/issues/25543",
    "type": "issue_comment",
    "url": "https://github.com/sagemath/sage/issues/25543#issuecomment-394581",
    "user": "https://github.com/tscrim"
}
```

<a id='comment:17'></a>
Some more superficial comments:

- I would rename `OMPBasis_OMPNSym` to `OMPNSymBasis_abstract` (at least, that is my understanding of its role).
- Remove the period here: `around which the primitive is built.`
- This is overindented:

  ```
        .. TODO::

            - sort out the degree issues above. (search for "wrong!!!")
  ```
- For this:

  ```
  .. TODO: Do we need these tests, or are they checked within TestSuite?::
  ```
  the answer is yes, they are checked by the `_test_antipode` unless I am misremembering something.
- `.. MATH::` needs a blankline before it (see `coproduct_on_basis`).
- I would put the `TestSuite` tests in the `__init__` method rather than the class-level doc.
- `*Warning:*` -> `.. WARNING::`.
- The `__classcall_private__` will need doctests.



---
